text: <@U055JANKU>: yep i’ve used it before, it’s quite nice.. including the mikepenz/materialize library as well which is a transitive dependency...
Might not be the right room for this, but what is a transitive dependency?

<@U054AD9CZ>: a transitive dependency is a dependency of a dependency. Transitive meaning:
> (of a relation) such that, if it applies between successive members of a sequence, it must also apply between any two members taken in order. For instance, if A is larger than B, and B is larger than C, then A is larger than C.
Afaik transitive dependencies are not included in your project by Gradle. So if dependency A in your project depends on dependency B, you cannot use B from your project unless you specifically ask Gradle to (see transitive dependencies Gradle ofc).
Correct but you can tell a dependency to include it's deps by doing { transitive true}
On the dep declaration. Really helpful for deps that have multiple but necessary dependencies
